        // One-time XP reward for setting a valid allowance
        maybeAwardAllowanceXP();

        renderForCurrentMonth();
        closeAllowanceModal();
      };
    }
  }

  function showAllowanceCalc() {
    allowanceFlow.mode = "calc";
    if (allowanceBack()) allowanceBack().style.display = "inline-block";
    const submit = allowanceSubmit();
    if (submit) {
      submit.style.display = "inline-block";
      submit.textContent = "Set Global Allowance";
    }

    allowanceStage().innerHTML = 
      <p>Allowance = Income (Rent +Car +Bills +Savings +Other)</p>
      <div style="display:grid; grid-template-columns:1fr 1fr; gap:10px;">
        ${["Income","Rent","Car Payments","Bills","Ideal Savings","Other"].map(label => 
          <label style="display:flex; flex-direction:column; gap:6px;">
            <span style="font-size:14px; color:#333;">${label}</span>
            <input type="number" step="0.01" min="0" placeholder="${label}"
                   data-allowance="${label}"
                   style="padding:8px; font-size:16px; width:100%; box-sizing:border-box;"
                   value="0" />
          </label>
        ).join("")}
      </div>
    ;

    if (allowanceBack()) allowanceBack().onclick = showAllowanceCombined;

    if (submit) {
      submit.onclick = () => {
        const vals = {};
        document
          .querySelectorAll('[data-allowance]')
          .forEach(el => {
            vals[el.dataset.allowance] = parseFloat(el.value) || 0;
          });
        const income = vals["Income"];
        const costs = vals["Rent"] + vals["Car Payments"] +
                      vals["Bills"] + vals["Ideal Savings"] + vals["Other"];

        settings.allowance = income - costs;
        saveSettings();

        // One-time XP reward for setting a valid allowance
        maybeAwardAllowanceXP();

        renderForCurrentMonth();
        closeAllowanceModal();
      };
    }
  }

  on(allowanceOverlay, "click", (e)=>{
    if (e.target === allowanceOverlay) closeAllowanceModal();
  });
  on(document, "keydown", (e)=>{
    if (allowanceOverlay && allowanceOverlay.style.display === "flex" && e.key === "Escape") {
      closeAllowanceModal();
    }
  });
  on(allowanceCancel(), "click", closeAllowanceModal);
  on(setAllowanceBtn, "click", openAllowanceModal);

  /* ---------- Favourites Modal ---------- */
  const openFavesModal = () => {
    renderFavesModal();
    setDisplay(favesOverlay, true);
  };
  const closeFavesModal = () => setDisplay(favesOverlay, false);

  const escapeHtml = (s) =>
    String(s).replace(/[&<>"']/g, (c) => ({
      "&": "&amp;",
      "<": "&lt;",
      ">": "&gt;",
      '"': "&quot;",
      "'": "&#39;",
    }[c]));

  function renderFavesModal() {
    const entries = Object.entries(favourites);
    if (!entries.length) {
      favesList.innerHTML = <p>No favourites yet.</p>;
      return;
    }

    entries.sort((a,b) => {
      const fa = a[1], fb = b[1];
      return (
        ((fb.year|0) - (fa.year|0)) ||
        ((fb.monthIndex|0) - (fa.monthIndex|0)) ||
        ((fb.id|0) - (fa.id|0))
      );
    });

    const rows = entries.map(([key, f]) => 
      <tr data-key="${key}">
        <td class="fav-name">${escapeHtml(f.name || "Favourite")}</td>
        <td>${(f.amount || 0).toFixed(2)}</td>
        <td>${f.category}</td>
        <td class="fav-actions">
          <button class="fave-add" type="button" data-key="${key}">Add</button>
          <span class="mini-inline delete-mini fav-delete"
                title="Delete" data-key="${key}">d</span>
        </td>
      </tr>
    ).join("");

    favesList.innerHTML = 
      <table>
        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>Name</th><th>Amount</th><th>Category</th><th>Action</th>
          </tr>
        </thead>
        <tbody>${rows}</tbody>
      </table>
    ;
  }

  on(favesOverlay, "click", (e)=>{
    if (e.target === favesOverlay) closeFavesModal();
  });
  on(document, "keydown", (e)=>{
    if (favesOverlay && favesOverlay.style.display === "flex" && e.key === "Escape") {
      closeFavesModal();
    }
  });
  on(favesCloseBtn, "click", closeFavesModal);
  on(showFavouritesBtn, "click", openFavesModal);

  on(favesList, "click", (e) => {
    const add = e.target.closest(".fave-add");
    const del = e.target.closest(".fav-delete");

    if (add) {
      const oldKey = add.dataset.key;
      const fav = favourites[oldKey];
      if (!fav) return;

      const data = getMonthData();

      if (data.noSpending) subtractScore(5);
      data.noSpending = false;

      data.purchaseCount += 1;
      const newId = data.purchaseCount;

      // Add a new expense row based on the favourite
      data.expenses.push({
        id: newId,
        amount: fav.amount,
        category: fav.category
      });
      data.categoryTotals[fav.category] =
        (data.categoryTotals[fav.category] || 0) + (fav.amount || 0);

      // Move the favourite to point at the new row (no duplication)
      const newKey = compositeId(newId);
      if (newKey !== oldKey) {
        delete favourites[oldKey];
      }
      favourites[newKey] = {
        id: newId,
        year: currentYear,
        monthIndex: currentMonthIndex,
        amount: fav.amount,
        category: fav.category,
        name: fav.name || "Favourite"
      };
      saveFavourites();

      applyStreakScore(1, "great addition! +10XP");

      saveState();
      renderForCurrentMonth();
      closeFavesModal();
      return;
    }

    if (del) {
      const key = del.dataset.key;
      if (!key) return;
      delete favourites[key];
      saveFavourites();
      renderFavesModal();
      // Keep rails in sync: unfilling stars for rows that lost favourites
      renderForCurrentMonth();
    }
  });

  /* ---------- Favourite Name Modal ---------- */
  let pendingFav = null;
  function openFavNameModal(snapshot, defaultName = "") {
    pendingFav = { ...snapshot, name: defaultName || "" };
    favNameInput.value = pendingFav.name;
    setDisplay(favNameOverlay, true);
    setTimeout(()=> favNameInput.focus(), 0);
  }
  function closeFavNameModal() {
    setDisplay(favNameOverlay, false);
    pendingFav = null;
  }

  on(favNameOverlay, "click", (e)=>{
    if (e.target === favNameOverlay) closeFavNameModal();
  });
  on(document, "keydown", (e)=>{
    if (favNameOverlay && favNameOverlay.style.display === "flex" && e.key === "Escape") {
      closeFavNameModal();
    }
  });
  on(favNameSave, "click", () => {
    if (!pendingFav) return;
    const name = favNameInput.value.trim() || "Favourite";
    const { key, year, monthIndex, id, amount, category } = pendingFav;
    favourites[key] = { id, year, monthIndex, amount, category, name };
    saveFavourites();
    closeFavNameModal();
    renderForCurrentMonth();
    if (favesOverlay && favesOverlay.style.display === "flex") renderFavesModal();
  });

  /* ---------- Openers ---------- */
  on(addBtn, "click", openAddTypeModal);

  /* ---------- Initial render ---------- */
  renderForCurrentMonth();
});

ChatGPT said:
Right now your JS actually looks sane  the most likely reason those new buttons feel dead is that the HTML theyre trying to open doesnt exist yet.


In this JS youre wiring buttons to these elements:


    

  • 

    Analytics  analyticsModalOverlay
    

    • 

  • 

    Leaderboard  leaderboardModalOverlay
    

    • 

  • 

    Rewards  rewardsModalOverlay
    

    • 

  • 

    Set Goal  goalModalOverlay
    

    • 



If those IDs arent present in your HTML, then:


js
const analyticsOverlay = $("analyticsModalOverlay"); // => null
...
on(analyticsBtn, "click", openAnalyticsModal); // ok



and in openAnalyticsModal:


js
setDisplay(analyticsOverlay, true); // does nothing because el is null



So the click handler runs, but nothing is shown  it looks like the button doesnt work.




1. Add the modals to your HTML


Drop these somewhere near the bottom of your <body> (before </body>), in addition to your existing expense / favourites / allowance modals.


Analytics modal


html
<!-- Analytics Modal -->
<div id="analyticsModalOverlay" class="modal-overlay" style="display:none;" role="dialog">
  <div class="modal analytics-modal">
    <button type="button" class="modal-close-x">&times;</button>
    <h3>Spending analytics</h3>

    <div id="analyticsTotals" class="analytics-totals">
      <!-- Filled by JS -->
    </div>

    <div class="analytics-chart-wrap">
      <canvas id="analyticsChart"></canvas>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>



Leaderboard modal


html
<!-- Leaderboard Modal -->
<div id="leaderboardModalOverlay" class="modal-overlay" style="display:none;" role="dialog">
  <div class="modal leaderboard-modal">
    <button type="button" class="modal-close-x">&times;</button>
    <h3>Leaderboard</h3>

    <div class="leaderboard-toggle-row">
      <button id="leaderboardToggleXp" type="button" class="toggle-btn active">
        By XP
      </button>
      <button id="leaderboardToggleStreak" type="button" class="toggle-btn">
        By streak
      </button>
    </div>

    <table class="leaderboard-table">
      <thead>
        <tr>
          <th>#</th>
          <th>Name</th>
          <th>Level</th>
          <th>XP</th>
          <th>Streak</th>
        </tr>
      </thead>
      <tbody id="leaderboardTableBody">
        <!-- Filled by JS -->
      </tbody>
    </table>
  </div>
</div>



Rewards (goals) modal


This matches the currentGoalsList / completedGoalsList that your JS expects:


html
<!-- Rewards / Goals Modal -->
<div id="rewardsModalOverlay" class="modal-overlay" style="display:none;" role="dialog">
  <div class="modal rewards-modal">
    <button type="button" class="modal-close-x">&times;</button>
    <h3>Rewards</h3>

    <div class="rewards-columns">
      <section class="rewards-section">
        <h4>Current goals</h4>
        <ul id="currentGoalsList">
          <!-- JS fills in active goal + savings target -->
        </ul>
      </section>

      <section class="rewards-section">
        <h4>Goals completed</h4>
        <ul id="completedGoalsList">
          <!-- JS fills from settings.completedGoals -->
        </ul>
      </section>
    </div>
  </div>
</div>



Goal-setup modal


You also call openGoalModal() from the green Set Goal button, expecting this structure:


html
<!-- Set Goal Modal -->
<div id="goalModalOverlay" class="modal-overlay" style="display:none;" role="dialog">
  <div class="modal goal-modal">
    <button type="button" class="modal-close-x">&times;</button>
    <h3>Set a goal</h3>

    <div class="goal-presets">
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="goalPreset" value="example1">
        Complete 3 No Spending Days in a 7 day period.
      </label>
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="goalPreset" value="example2">
        Achieve diamond level.
      </label>
      <label>
        <input type="radio" name="goalPreset" value="example3">
        Spend an average of less than $20/day this week.
      </label>
    </div>

    <div class="goal-target">
      <label for="goalTargetInput">
        Savings target (optional)
      </label>
      <input id="goalTargetInput" type="number" step="0.01" min="0"
             placeholder="e.g. 100.00">
    </div>

    <button id="goalSaveBtn" type="button">Save goal</button>
  </div>
</div>



Once these are in place (with the exact IDs), your existing JS should:


    

  • 

    Open Analytics with a pie chart and totals.
    

    • 

  • 

    Open Leaderboard with fake data + XP/Streak toggle.
    

    • 

  • 

    Open Rewards with Current goals and Goals completed lists.
    

    • 

  • 

    Open Set Goal to configure a preset and/or savings target.
    

    • 





2. Quick sanity check


After adding the HTML:


    

  1. 

    Reload the page.
    

    2. 

  2. 

    Open DevTools  Console and make sure there are no red errors on load.
    

    3. 

  3. 

    Click:
    

      

    • 

      Set Goal  goal modal pop up
      

      • 

    • 

      Rewards  rewards modal
      

      • 

    • 

      Leaderboard  leaderboard table
      

      • 

    • 

      Analytics  chart modal
      

      • 

    

    4. 



If anything still feels dead after adding those blocks, the next thing to grab is the first red error line from the console and we can chase that down.
You said:
all buttons are dead 
ChatGPT said:
You said:
can you make the leaderboard table have the same aesthetics as the main table and the table in the favourites button. also make the xp/streak toggle the same as the weekly/daily toggle in allowance info
ChatGPT said:
Right now your JavaScript is almost certainly crashing before any of the on(...) listeners are attached  thats why all buttons feel dead.


1. Likely cause of all buttons are dead


The first really suspicious bit is this:


js
const chartCanvas = $("categoryChart");
if (chartCanvas) {
  const ctx = chartCanvas.getContext("2d");
  categoryChart = new Chart(ctx, {
    // ...
  });
}



If Chart.js isnt loaded (or the <script> for Chart runs after this file), new Chart(...) will throw:




ReferenceError: Chart is not defined




When that happens, the DOMContentLoaded callback bails out right here and everything after it (all the on(button, "click", ...) stuff) never runs  every button appears dead.


Quick fix


Change both Chart usages to guard on window.Chart:


js
/* ---------- Chart (main sidebar pie - optional) ---------- */
let categoryChart = null;

const chartCanvas = $("categoryChart");
if (chartCanvas && window.Chart) {        //  add window.Chart guard
  const ctx = chartCanvas.getContext("2d");
  categoryChart = new Chart(ctx, {
    // ...
  });
}

// ...

function renderAnalyticsChart() {
  const canvas = analyticsChartEl();
  if (!canvas || !window.Chart) return;   //  guard here too

  const ctxA = canvas.getContext("2d");
  // rest stays the same
}



Do that first, refresh, and your buttons should spring back to life.

(If they dont, open DevTools  Console and see what the first red error is.)




2. Make leaderboard table match other tables


Well do this by:


    

  1. 

    Creating a shared table class (e.g. .styled-table).
    

    2. 

  2. 

    Using that class for:
    

      

    • 

      Main expenses table
      

      • 

    • 

      Favourites table
      

      • 

    • 

      Leaderboard table
      

      • 

    

    3. 



a) CSS: shared table style


Add this to your style.css (or merge with existing table styles):


css
/* ===== Shared table aesthetics ===== */
.styled-table {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  font-size: 0.9rem;
  background: var(--card-bg);
  border-radius: 12px;
  overflow: hidden;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
}

.styled-table thead {
  background: rgba(11, 42, 74, 0.95); /* var(--navy) tinted */
  color: #fff;
}

.styled-table th,
.styled-table td {
  padding: 8px 10px;
  text-align: left;
  border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border);
}

.styled-table tbody tr:nth-child(even) {
  background: #f9fafb;
}

.styled-table tbody tr:last-child td {
  border-bottom: none;
}

.styled-table tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(17, 205, 239, 0.08); /* var(--turquoise) tint */
}



b) HTML: apply to your three tables


Main expenses table

Make sure it looks like:


html
<table id="submittedExpenses" class="styled-table">
  <!-- thead + tbody as you already have -->
</table>



Leaderboard table

In your leaderboard modal HTML, make sure the table is:


html
<table id="leaderboardTable" class="styled-table">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>#</th>
      <th>Name</th>
      <th>Level</th>
      <th>XP</th>
      <th>Streak</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody id="leaderboardTableBody"></tbody>
</table>



Favourites table (JS change)

In your JS you currently render it like this:


js
favesList.innerHTML = `
  <table>
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Name</th><th>Amount</th><th>Category</th><th>Action</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>${rows}</tbody>
  </table>
`;



Change that to:


js
favesList.innerHTML = `
  <table class="styled-table">
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Name</th><th>Amount</th><th>Category</th><th>Action</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>${rows}</tbody>
  </table>
`;

You said:
the buttons are fixed. can you make the leaderboard table have the same aesthetics as the main table and the table in the favourites button. also make the xp/streak toggle the same as the weekly/daily toggle in allowance info
ChatGPT said:
Nice, glad the buttons are alive again 

Lets just do cosmetics now: leaderboard table + XP/Streak toggle.




1. Make the leaderboard table match main + favourites


a) CSS  shared table style


Add this to your style.css (or merge into your existing table styles):


css
/* ===== Shared table aesthetics for all app tables ===== */
.styled-table {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  font-size: 0.9rem;
  background: var(--card-bg);
  border-radius: 12px;
  overflow: hidden;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
}

.styled-table thead {
  background: rgba(11, 42, 74, 0.95); /* navy-ish */
  color: #fff;
}

.styled-table th,
.styled-table td {
  padding: 8px 10px;
  text-align: left;
  border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border);
}

.styled-table tbody tr:nth-child(even) {
  background: #f9fafb;
}

.styled-table tbody tr:last-child td {
  border-bottom: none;
}

.styled-table tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(17, 205, 239, 0.08); /* turquoise tint */
}



b) Main expenses table


In your HTML, make sure the main table has this class:


html
<table id="submittedExpenses" class="styled-table">
  <!-- thead + tbody here -->
</table>



(If it already has another class, you can do class="styled-table some-other-class".)


c) Favourites table (JS change)


In your current JS, inside renderFavesModal() you have:


js
favesList.innerHTML = `
  <table>
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Name</th><th>Amount</th><th>Category</th><th>Action</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>${rows}</tbody>
  </table>
`;



Change that to:


js
favesList.innerHTML = `
  <table class="styled-table">
    <thead>
      <tr>
        <th>Name</th><th>Amount</th><th>Category</th><th>Action</th>
      </tr>
    </thead>
    <tbody>${rows}</tbody>
  </table>
`;



d) Leaderboard table HTML


In your leaderboard modal HTML, make the table:


html
<table id="leaderboardTable" class="styled-table">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>#</th>
      <th>Name</th>
      <th>Level</th>
      <th>XP</th>
      <th>Streak</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody id="leaderboardTableBody"></tbody>
</table>



Your JS renderLeaderboard() already writes <tr>...</tr> into leaderboardTableBody, so nothing else to change there.


Now all three tables (main, favourites, leaderboard) will share the same look.




2. Make XP/Streak toggle match Weekly/Daily toggle


Well give all four buttons a shared pill-toggle style and rely on the .active class you already use in JS.


a) CSS for shared toggle style


Add this to style.css:


css
/* ===== Shared pill toggles (Weekly/Daily & XP/Streak) ===== */
.toggle-pill-group {
  display: inline-flex;
  gap: 4px;
  padding: 4px;
  border-radius: 999px;
  background: rgba(11, 42, 74, 0.06); /* light navy tint */
}

.toggle-pill {
  border: none;
  border-radius: 999px;
  padding: 6px 14px;
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  cursor: pointer;
  background: transparent;
  color: var(--navy);
  opacity: 0.7;
  transition:
    background 0.2s ease,
    color 0.2s ease,
    opacity 0.2s ease,
    transform 0.1s ease;
}

.toggle-pill:hover {
  opacity: 0.9;
  transform: translateY(-1px);
}

.toggle-pill.active {
  background: var(--turquoise);
  color: #fff;
  opacity: 1;
}



b) Weekly/Daily allowance toggle HTML


Wrap your existing weekly/daily buttons in a group and add the class:


html
<div class="toggle-pill-group">
  <button id="allowWeeklyBtn" class="toggle-pill" type="button">Weekly</button>
  <button id="allowDailyBtn" class="toggle-pill" type="button">Daily</button>
</div>



Your JS already does:


js
const weeklyBtn = $("allowWeeklyBtn");
const dailyBtn = $("allowDailyBtn");

function refreshAllowanceToggleButtons() {
  if (!weeklyBtn || !dailyBtn) return;
  const mode = settings.allowanceMode || "weekly";
  weeklyBtn.classList.toggle("active", mode === "weekly");
  dailyBtn.classList.toggle("active", mode === "daily");
}



So with .toggle-pill + .active theyll pick up the new pill look automatically.


c) XP / Streak toggle HTML


Do the same thing for leaderboard:


html
<div class="toggle-pill-group">
  <button id="leaderboardToggleXp" class="toggle-pill" type="button">XP</button>
  <button id="leaderboardToggleStreak" class="toggle-pill" type="button">Streak</button>
</div>



JS you already have:


js
const leaderboardToggleXp = $("leaderboardToggleXp");
const leaderboardToggleStreak = $("leaderboardToggleStreak");

let leaderboardSortMode = "xp";

function refreshLeaderboardToggleButtons() {
  if (!leaderboardToggleXp || !leaderboardToggleStreak) return;
  leaderboardToggleXp.classList.toggle("active", leaderboardSortMode === "xp");
  leaderboardToggleStreak.classList.toggle("active", leaderboardSortMode === "streak");
}

on(leaderboardToggleXp, "click", () => {
  leaderboardSortMode = "xp";
  renderLeaderboard();
});

on(leaderboardToggleStreak, "click", () => {
  leaderboardSortMode = "streak";
  renderLeaderboard();
});



With the new CSS + .toggle-pill class, these will look and behave like a second copy of the Weekly/Daily toggle.




If you want, you can paste your leaderboard modal HTML and allowance section HTML and Ill wire the exact snippets into your existing structure so you can copypaste directly.
You said:
i am confused. i only wnated to change the leaderboard table to match the others. is all of this relevant 
ChatGPT said:
Yep, fair enough  that was a lot for what you asked 

Lets just do the tiny changes you actually need.




1. Make the leaderboard table match the others


Assuming your leaderboard modal HTML has something like:


html
<table id="leaderboardTable">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th>#</th>
      <th>Name</th>
      <th>Level</th>
      <th>XP</th>
      <th>Streak</th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody id="leaderboardTableBody"></tbody>
</table>



Add this CSS to style.css to give it the same look as your main/favourites table:


css
/* Leaderboard table  match main/favourites table style */
#leaderboardTable {
  width: 100%;
  border-collapse: collapse;
  margin: 0.5rem 0;
  font-size: 0.9rem;
  background: var(--card-bg);
  border-radius: 12px;
  overflow: hidden;
  box-shadow: 0 4px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.06);
}

#leaderboardTable thead {
  background: rgba(11, 42, 74, 0.95); /* similar to main table header */
  color: #fff;
}

#leaderboardTable th,
#leaderboardTable td {
  padding: 8px 10px;
  text-align: left;
  border-bottom: 1px solid var(--border);
}

#leaderboardTable tbody tr:nth-child(even) {
  background: #f9fafb;
}

#leaderboardTable tbody tr:last-child td {
  border-bottom: none;
}

#leaderboardTable tbody tr:hover {
  background: rgba(17, 205, 239, 0.08); /* turquoise tint hover */
}



Nothing else in JS needs to change for the table.




2. Make the XP / Streak toggle match Weekly / Daily


You already have:


js
const leaderboardToggleXp = $("leaderboardToggleXp");
const leaderboardToggleStreak = $("leaderboardToggleStreak");
let leaderboardSortMode = "xp";

function refreshLeaderboardToggleButtons() {
  if (!leaderboardToggleXp || !leaderboardToggleStreak) return;
  leaderboardToggleXp.classList.toggle("active", leaderboardSortMode === "xp");
  leaderboardToggleStreak.classList.toggle("active", leaderboardSortMode === "streak");
}



So we just need some CSS that mirrors your weekly/daily behaviour, using .active.


Make sure your HTML looks like this:


html
<div class="leaderboard-toggles">
  <button id="leaderboardToggleXp" type="button">XP</button>
  <button id="leaderboardToggleStreak" type="button">Streak</button>
</div>



Then add this CSS:


css
/* XP / Streak toggle  styled similar to Weekly / Daily toggle */
#leaderboardToggleXp,
#leaderboardToggleStreak {
  padding: 4px 10px;
  border-radius: 999px;
  border: 1px solid var(--border);
  background: #fff;
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  cursor: pointer;
  margin-right: 4px;
  color: var(--navy);
  transition: background 0.2s ease, color 0.2s ease, border-color 0.2s ease;
}

#leaderboardToggleXp.active,
#leaderboardToggleStreak.active {
  background: var(--turquoise);
  color: #fff;
  border-color: var(--turquoise);
}



Thats it:


    

  • 

    Leaderboard table now styled like your other tables.
    

    • 

  • 

    XP/Streak toggle behaves like Weekly/Daily (same active-state pill look).
    

    • 



If you want, you can paste the leaderboard modal HTML and Ill drop this straight into that structure for you.
You said:
the files look like this, is it correct:

js:
/* XP / Streak toggle  styled similar to Weekly / Daily toggle */
#leaderboardToggleXp,
#leaderboardToggleStreak {
  padding: 4px 10px;
  border-radius: 999px;
  border: 1px solid var(--border);
  background: #fff;
  font-size: 0.8rem;
  cursor: pointer;
  margin-right: 4px;
  color: var(--navy);
  transition: background 0.2s ease, color 0.2s ease, border-color 0.2s ease;
}

#leaderboardToggleXp.active,
#leaderboardToggleStreak.active {
  background: var(--turquoise);
  color: #fff;
  border-color: var(--turquoise);
}


html:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">

  <meta charset="UTF-8" />
  <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
  <title>SavR - Add Expense</title>
  <link rel="stylesheet" href="style.css" />
</head>
<body>
  <!-- Month selector row -->
  <div id="monthControls">
    <button id="prevMonthBtn" type="button" aria-label="Previous day"></button>
    <button id="dayCounterBtn" type="button" aria-label="Day counter" disabled>Day 1</button>
    <button id="nextMonthBtn" type="button" aria-label="Next day"></button>

    <!-- New: Hard reset button -->
    <button id="hardResetBtn" type="button" aria-label="Hard reset everything">
      Hard reset
    </button>
  </div>

  <h1>SavR</h1>
  <h3>how the fuck am i poor again? where the fuck is my money going? help pls...</h3>

    <div class="main-column">
      <div class="top-row">

          <div id="expenseContainer"></div>

            <div id="scoreTotal"> XP: 0</div>
            <div id="streakDisplay"> Streak: 0 days</div>
            <div id="levelDisplay"> Level: Bronze</div>
          </div>
        </div>

                  <th scope="col">#</th>

        <button id="leaderboardBtn" type="button">Leaderboard</button>

      </div>
    </aside>
  </div>

      class="modal-overlay"
      role="dialog"
      aria-modal="true"
      style="display:none;">

              type="button"

        &times;
      </button>

          XP
        </button>

                type="button"
                class="leaderboard-toggle-btn">
          Streak
        </button>
      </div>

        <thead>
          <tr>
            <th>Pos</th>
            <th>Name</th>
            <th>Level</th>
            <th>XP</th>
            <th>Streak</th>

      </table>

      </div>

          id="goalTargetInput"
          type="number"
          min="0"
          step="0.01"
          placeholder="e.g. 500.00"
        />
      </label>

      </button>

    </div>
  </div>

CSS:
:root {
  /* Palette */
  --turquoise: #11cdef;
  --navy: #0b2a4a;
  --teal: #0f766e;
  --amber: #ffb000;

  /* Derived colors */
  --page-bg: linear-gradient(to bottom, #e9f9ff, #fffaf2);
  --card-bg: #ffffff;
  --text: #1a1a1a;
  --border: #d0d0d0;
}

/* ===== Global ===== */
body {
  font-family: "Raleway", "Lato", sans-serif;
  padding: 20px;
  margin: 0;
  background: var(--page-bg);
  color: var(--text);
}

h1 {
  font-size: 2rem;
  margin: 0.5em 0 0.2em;
